article_title: Ben Nelson: Dodd-Frank Comes for the Insurers
article_text:
For nearly 150 years, states have regulated America's insurance companies. In all that time, even during the 2008 financial crisis, this stable industry has fortified the broader economy. Now the federal government has set out to fix something that isn't broken, foisting federal banklike regulation on insurance companies.

The change comes courtesy of the 2010 Dodd-Frank law, which created the Financial Stability Oversight Council to identify nonbank financial institutions whose failure "could pose a threat to the...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Ben Nelson writes that bank-style regulation on the industry will encourage risky behavior.
twitter.title: Dodd-Frank Comes for the Insurers
